summary: BRĂILA Have you arrived in Brăila and need help? Find information on how to manage in a new city and who can help you. Important contacts Brăila County Immigration Office: 0239 606 100 / br.igi@mai.gov.ro Emergency call number: 112 National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania ✆ 0800 800 678 / 021 313 3100 The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Brăila Information required for the accommodation, board and integration support program. More details Public transport in Brăila Find out how and where you can buy tickets for public transport in Brăila. More information Medical services If you need medical services, you can go to the County Emergency Clinical Hospital Brăila. Here you can find a list of family doctors in Braila. Find out more about healthcare in Romania Education Find out here how you can enroll your child in primary education and what documents are required. More information about the education system in Romania Organisations offering their support Find support in your city - explore the map for service providers near you! Legal status Housing Info Stay safe Jobs Support Women's Center If you need support in accessing reproductive health services as well as support in navigating the health system or you need services dedicated to victims of domestic violence, click here. Ask for help Counseling for people living with HIV If you arrive in Romania and need free, anonymous and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services, you can receive the support of specialist doctors from 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.
